title: ManifestDefinition
description:
Use a ManifestDefinition to define a manifest and to build a `ManifestStore`.
A manifest is a collection of ingredients and assertions
used to define a claim that can be signed and embedded into a file.

claim_version.description: The version of the claim.  Defaults to 2.

vendor.description:
Optional prefix added to the generated Manifest Label
This is typically a reverse domain name.

claim_generator_info.description: Claim Generator Info is always required with an entry

metadata.description: Optional manifest metadata. This will be deprecated in the future; not recommended to use.

title.description: A human-readable title, generally source filename.

format.description: The format of the source file as a MIME type.

instance_id.description: Instance ID from `xmpMM:InstanceID` in XMP metadata.

thumbnail.description:
An optional ResourceRef to a thumbnail image that represents the asset that was signed.
Must be available when the manifest is signed.

redactions.description: A list of redactions - URIs to redacted assertions.

label.description:
Allows you to pre-define the manifest label, which must be unique.
Not intended for general use.  If not set, it will be assigned automatically.

ClaimGeneratorInfo.description:
Description of the claim generator, or the software used in generating the claim.

This structure is also used for actions softwareAgent

name.description: A human readable string naming the claim_generator

version.description: A human readable string of the product's version

icon.description: hashed URI to the icon (either embedded or remote)

operating_system.description: A human readable string of the OS the claim generator is running on

ResourceRef.description:
A reference to a resource to be used in JSON serialization.

The underlying data can be read as a stream via [`Reader::resource_to_stream`][crate::Reader::resource_to_stream].

format.description: The mime type of the referenced resource.

identifier.description:
A URI that identifies the resource as referenced from the manifest.

This may be a JUMBF URI, a file path, a URL or any other string.
Relative JUMBF URIs will be resolved with the manifest label.
Relative file paths will be resolved with the base path if provided.

data_types.description: More detailed data types as defined in the C2PA spec.

alg.description: The algorithm used to hash the resource (if applicable).

hash.description: The hash of the resource (if applicable).

HashedUri.description:
A `HashedUri` provides a reference to content available within the same
manifest store.

This is described in [ยง8.3, URI References], of the C2PA Technical
Specification.

[ยง8.3, URI References]: https://c2pa.org/specifications/specifications/2.1/specs/C2PA_Specification.html#_uri_references

alg.description:
A string identifying the cryptographic hash algorithm used to compute
the hash

hash.description: Byte string containing the hash value

AssertionMetadata.description: The AssertionMetadata structure can be used as part of other assertions or on its own to reference others

ReviewRating.description:
A rating on an Assertion.

See <https://c2pa.org/specifications/specifications/2.2/specs/C2PA_Specification.html#_review_ratings>.

DataSource.description: A description of the source for assertion data

type.description: A value from among the enumerated list indicating the source of the assertion.

details.description: A human-readable string giving details about the source of the assertion data.

actors.description: A list of [`Actor`]s associated with this source.

Actor.description: Identifies a person responsible for an action.

identifier.description: An identifier for a human actor, used when the "type" is `humanEntry.identified`.

credentials.description: List of references to W3C Verifiable Credentials.

RegionOfInterest.description:
A region of interest within an asset describing the change.

This struct can be used from [`Action::changes`][crate::assertions::Action::changes],
[`AssertionMetadata::region_of_interest`][crate::assertions::AssertionMetadata::region_of_interest], or
[`SoftBindingScope::region`][crate::assertions::soft_binding::SoftBindingScope::region].

region.description: A range describing the region of interest for the specific asset.

name.description: A free-text string representing a human-readable name for the region which might be used in a user interface.

identifier.description: A free-text string representing a machine-readable, unique to this assertion, identifier for the region.

type.description:
A value from a controlled vocabulary such as <https://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/imageregiontype/> or an entity-specific
value (e.g., com.litware.newType) that represents the type of thing(s) depicted by a region.

Note this field serializes/deserializes into the name `type`.

role.description:
A value from our controlled vocabulary or an entity-specific value (e.g., com.litware.coolArea) that represents
the role of a region among other regions.

Range.description: A spatial, temporal, frame, or textual range describing the region of interest.

type.description: The type of range of interest.

RangeType.description: The type of range for the region of interest.

oneOf.description: A spatial range, see [`Shape`] for more details.
A temporal range, see [`Time`] for more details.
A spatial range, see [`Frame`] for more details.
A textual range, see [`Text`] for more details.
A range identified by a specific identifier and value, see [`Item`] for more details.

Shape.description: A spatial range representing rectangle, circle, or a polygon.

unit.description: The type of unit for the shape range.

origin.description: THe origin of the coordinate in the shape.

width.description:
The width for rectangles or diameter for circles.

This field can be ignored for polygons.

height.description:
The height of a rectnagle.

This field can be ignored for circles and polygons.

inside.description:
If the range is inside the shape.

The default value is true.

vertices.description:
The vertices of the polygon.

This field can be ignored for rectangles and circles.

ShapeType.description: The type of shape for the range.

oneOf.description: A rectangle.
A circle.
A polygon.

UnitType.description: The type of unit for the range.

oneOf.description: Use pixels.
Use percentage.

Coordinate.description: An x, y coordinate used for specifying vertices in polygons.

Time.description: A temporal range representing a starting time to an ending time.

start.description: The start time or the start of the asset if not present.

end.description: The end time or the end of the asset if not present.

oneOf.description: Times are described using Normal Play Time (npt) as described in RFC 2326.

Frame.description:
A frame range representing starting and ending frames or pages.

If both `start` and `end` are missing, the frame will span the entire asset.

start.description:
The start of the frame or the end of the asset if not present.

The first frame/page starts at 0.

end.description: The end of the frame inclusive or the end of the asset if not present.

Text.description: A textual range representing multiple (possibly discontinuous) ranges of text.

selectors.description: The ranges of text to select.

TextSelectorRange.description: One or two [`TextSelector`][TextSelector] identifiying the range to select.

end.description: The end of the text range.

TextSelector.description:
Selects a range of text via a fragment identifier.

This is modeled after the W3C Web Annotation selector model.

fragment.description: Fragment identifier as per RFC3023 (XML) or ISO 32000-2 (PDF), Annex O.

start.description: The start character offset or the start of the fragment if not present.

end.description: The end character offset or the end of the fragment if not present.

Item.description: Description of the boundaries of an identified range.

identifier.description: The container-specific term used to identify items, such as "track_id" for MP4 or "item_ID" for HEIF.

value.description: The value of the identifier, e.g. a value of "2" for an identifier of "track_id" would imply track 2 of the asset.

oneOf.description: Arbitrary area worth identifying.
This area is all that is left after a crop action.
This area has had edits applied to it.
The area where an ingredient was placed/added.
Something in this area was redacted.
Area specific to a subject (human or not).
A range of information was removed/deleted.
Styling was applied to this area.
Invisible watermarking was applied to this area for the purpose of soft binding.

Ingredient.description: An `Ingredient` is any external asset that has been used in the creation of an asset.

title.description: A human-readable title, generally source filename.

format.description: The format of the source file as a MIME type.

document_id.description: Document ID from `xmpMM:DocumentID` in XMP metadata.

instance_id.description: Instance ID from `xmpMM:InstanceID` in XMP metadata.

thumbnail.description:
A thumbnail image capturing the visual state at the time of import.

A tuple of thumbnail MIME format (for example `image/jpeg`) and binary bits of the image.

hash.description: An optional hash of the asset to prevent duplicates.

relationship.description:
Set to `ParentOf` if this is the parent ingredient.

There can only be one parent ingredient in the ingredients.

active_manifest.description:
The active manifest label (if one exists).

If this ingredient has a [`ManifestStore`],
this will hold the label of the active [`Manifest`].

[`Manifest`]: crate::Manifest
[`ManifestStore`]: crate::ManifestStore

data.description: A reference to the actual data of the ingredient.

informational_URI.description: URI to an informational page about the ingredient or its data.

metadata.description:
Any additional [`Metadata`] as defined in the C2PA spec.

[`Metadata`]: crate::Metadata

data_types.description: Additional information about the data's type to the ingredient V2 structure.

manifest_data.description:
A [`ManifestStore`] from the source asset extracted as a binary C2PA blob.

[`ManifestStore`]: crate::ManifestStore

label.description: The ingredient's label as assigned in the manifest.

Relationship.description: The relationship of the ingredient to the current asset.

oneOf.description: The current asset is derived from this ingredient.
The current asset is a part of this ingredient.
The ingredient was used as an input to a computational process to create or modify the asset.

ValidationStatus.description:
A `ValidationStatus` struct describes the validation status of a
specific part of a manifest.

See <https://c2pa.org/specifications/specifications/2.2/specs/C2PA_Specification.html#_existing_manifests>.

ValidationResults.description:
A map of validation results for a manifest store.

The map contains the validation results for the active manifest and any ingredient deltas.
It is normal for there to be many

StatusCodes.description: Contains a set of success, informational, and failure validation status codes.

IngredientDeltaValidationResult.description: Represents any changes or deltas between the current and previous validation results for an ingredient's manifest.

ingredientAssertionURI.description: JUMBF URI reference to the ingredient assertion

validationDeltas.description: Validation results for the ingredient's active manifest

AssertionDefinition.description:
Defines an assertion that consists of a label that can be either
a C2PA-defined assertion label or a custom label in reverse domain format.

label.description: An assertion label in reverse domain format

kind.description: The kind of assertion data, either Cbor or Json (defaults to Cbor)

created.description: True if this assertion is attributed to the signer (defaults to false)

AssertionData.description:
This allows the assertion to be expressed as CBOR or JSON.
The default is CBOR unless you specify that an assertion should be JSON.

ManifestAssertionKind.description: Assertions in C2PA can be stored in several formats
